last_episode_to_air.name: On the Run
last_episode_to_air.overview: To search for a life of her own, Jaime resigns from the OSI and then flees for her life when the government tries to confine her to a compound for retired agents.

name: The Bionic Woman
overview: After fully recovering from her near fatal bout of bionic rejection, Jaime Sommers, the first female cyborg, is assigned to spy missions of her own.

episodes.name: Welcome Home, Jaime (1)
episodes.overview: Jaime Sommers, the first bionic woman, has her memory partly restored, but she can't remember having been engaged to Steve Austin.

episodes.name: Welcome Home, Jaime (2)
episodes.overview: Oscar arranges a 'falling out' with Jaime so that she can go undercover in businessman Carlton Harris's shady organization and determine whether he is trading illegal government secrets.

episodes.name: Angel of Mercy
episodes.overview: Oscar sends Jaime to war-torn Costa Brava to try and find the trapped American ambassador. To help her, he also sends pilot Jack Starkey. They make their dangerous journey through the desert, helped by a local boy. Eventually, they find the ambassador and manage to escape in an abandoned airplane.

episodes.name: A Thing of the Past
episodes.overview: Jaime tries  to help a  school bus driver  who has been hiding-out in Ojai for years, and is now being  tracked-down by underworld leaders who know that he once witnessed a crime.

episodes.name: Claws
episodes.overview: Jaime, left in charge of Susan Victor's  wild animal ranch, tries to save the life of a pet lion that is being stalked by irate ranchers.

episodes.name: The Deadly Missiles
episodes.overview: Jaime is sent  to investigate  her friend J.T. Conners after an unarmed  missile is  launched from his estate while the U.S. missile warning system was jammed.

episodes.name: Bionic Beauty
episodes.overview: Oscar enters Jaime as a contestant in the Miss United States Pageant in  order to uncover an espionage operation that is endangering American security plans.

episodes.name: Jaime's Mother
episodes.overview: Jaime's  mother has  supposedly returned  from the dead for a last visit with Jaime in Ojai knowing that foreign agents are  after her and that her visit endangers Jaime's life.

episodes.name: Winning Is Everything
episodes.overview: Jaime  becomes  Tim Sanders'  navigator in  an  international desert auto race in order to re-  trieve  a vital cassette  tape from  a foreign  country.

episodes.name: Canyon of Death
episodes.overview: Jaime is captured  by men who  are plotting to steal an  atomic-powered flying suit,  and her life depends  on a story-telling Indian boy's ability to convince someone that he saw a silver man in the desert.

episodes.name: Fly Jaime
episodes.overview: Jaime goes undercover as an airline stewardess to protect Dr. Rudy Wells and  the top-secret formula that he possesses.

episodes.name: The Jailing of Jaime
episodes.overview: Jaime  is  imprisoned  for  treason  after the forty million dollar decoding device  she was to deliver never arrives at its destination.

episodes.name: Mirror Image
episodes.overview: Lisa Galloway  is transformed  by plastic surgery into a double for Jaime, and successfully assumes her identity to obtain top-secret in information from Oscar Goldman's files.

episodes.name: The Ghosthunter
episodes.overview: Jaime becomes the governess for a girl in a small New England town when the top-secret project the girl's father is working on is disrupted by super-natural forces.

episodes.name: The Return of Bigfoot (II)
episodes.overview:
While searching for a missing OSI agent, Jaime must compete as Savage Sommers, a professional lady wrestler. 

The crossover starts on The Six Million Dollar Man S04E01 The Return of Bigfoot (I).

episodes.name: In This Corner, Jaime Sommers
episodes.overview: While searching for a missing OSI agent, Jaime must compete as Savage Sommers, a professional lady wrestler.

episodes.name: Assault on the Princess
episodes.overview: Jaime poses as a  blackjack  dealer aboard a luxurious sea-going casino in order to locate two missing energy cells that can be used as bombs.

episodes.name: Road to Nashville
episodes.overview: Jaime poses as a country singer to find a missing OSI agent,  and to stop the passing of top-secret information.

episodes.name: Kill Oscar (I)
episodes.overview:
Jaime lies near death after being attacked by two Fembots. Meanwhile, Steve locates the compound where Oscar is being held and attempts to rescue him. 

The crossover continues on The Six Million Dollar Man S04E06 Kill Oscar (II) and The Bionic Woman S02E06 Kill Oscar (III).

episodes.name: Kill Oscar (III)
episodes.overview:
Steve and Jaime become Oscar and Callahan's only hope of survival when Franklin uses the weather control machine to repel a military strike force from his island. This was the final part in a 3 part episode series. 

The crossover starts on The Bionic Woman S02E05 Kill Oscar (I) and The Six Million Dollar Man S04E06 Kill Oscar (II).

episodes.name: Black Magic
episodes.overview: Jaime is sent to a remote island to impersonate the niece of the  Carstairs family. When the family is sent on a scavenger hunt to find their dead brother's fortune, it's up to Jaime   to locate it first and obtain the formula for a top-secret alloy.

episodes.name: Sister Jaime
episodes.overview: Disguised as a nun, Jaime uncovers an international smuggling ring that's using a convent winery as a cover.

episodes.name: The Vega Influence
episodes.overview: At a government base on an isolated island, Jaime is pitted against a ""living"" meteorite's strange ability to overpower the human will.

episodes.name: Jaime's Shield (1)
episodes.overview: Jaime enrolls as a police academy cadet to locate a foreign agent. However, she is unaware that the agent has spotted her first and has ordered her execution.

episodes.name: Jaime's Shield (2)
episodes.overview: After graduating from  the  police academy, Jaime discovers that foreign agents are plotting to kidnap a visiting diplomat by impersonating the police force.

episodes.name: Biofeedback
episodes.overview: An OSI cryptographer's resentment of the organization's funding of his brother's biofeedback research drives him to sell his new top secret decoder on the black market.

episodes.name: Doomsday Is Tomorrow (1)
episodes.overview: Dr. Elijah Cooper, an aging scientist, threatens the release of a doomsday device unless world peace is maintained.

episodes.name: Doomsday Is Tomorrow (2)
episodes.overview: Jaime battles for her life as she tries to stop the launch of the doomsday device, which is  now controlled by the ALEX 7000  super-computer.

episodes.name: Deadly Ringer (1)
episodes.overview: A nightmare begins for Jaime when she regains consciousness  in a prison cell after being switched with her surgically created  look-alike, Lisa Galloway. Meanwhile, Lisa steals a top-secret  experimental drug from Dr. Rudy Wells which produces bionic-like strength.

episodes.name: Deadly Ringer (2)
episodes.overview: Following her prison escape, Jaime is unable to convince anyone, including Oscar, of her true identity. Back in Ojai, Lisa tries to become Jaime Sommers, but the drug she is using to produce super-strength is slowly poisoning her.

episodes.name: Jaime and the King
episodes.overview: Jaime becomes a tutor to a difficult young prince in order to protect his father from assassins.

episodes.name: Beyond the Call
episodes.overview: Jaime tries to befriend a withdrawn girl who hasn't spoken since her mother's death. Meanwhile, the girl's father plans to steal a top-secret missile guidance system.

episodes.name: The DeJon Caper
episodes.overview: Jaime travels to Paris with art forger Pierre Lambert to trap a master criminal and recover valuable paintings from him.

episodes.name: The Night Demon
episodes.overview: While visiting the ranch of Indian lore expert Thomas Bearclaw, Jaime is haunted by a legendary Indian burial demon.

episodes.name: Iron Ships and Dead Men
episodes.overview: Jaime boards an old World War II destroyer as a member of the  salvage crew to investigate the discovery of dog-tags bearing the name of Oscar's brother, Sam.

episodes.name: Once a Thief
episodes.overview: When a bumbling crook learns of Jaime's bionics, he blackmails her into helping him rob a bank.

episodes.name: The Bionic Dog (1)
episodes.overview: Jaime discovers the secret existence of the world's first bionic canine, and has five days to save him from certain death.

episodes.name: The Bionic Dog (2)
episodes.overview: When Max, the world's first bionic dog, runs off in the Sierra Nevada mountains, Jaime and an old flame follow him into a raging forest fire.

episodes.name: Fembots in Las Vegas (1)
episodes.overview: Carl, the son of the deranged Dr. Franklin, reactivates his father's army of female robots in order to steal America's first directed energy ray weapon.

episodes.name: Fembots in Las Vegas (2)
episodes.overview: Carl demands Jaime, Oscar, and Rudy as ransom for the stolen  energy ray weapon that he has launched into orbit and now controls.

episodes.name: Rodeo
episodes.overview: When OSI scientist Billy Cole insists on riding in a rodeo competition, Jaime is sent to secretly look after him.

episodes.name: African Connection
episodes.overview: In order to prevent a ruthless African dictator from remaining in power, Jaime must secretly switch a rigged computer element with one that will give fair results in an upcoming election.

episodes.name: Motorcycle Boogie
episodes.overview: Jaime enlists the help of dare-devil Evel Knievel in an attempt  to retrieve a computer tape stolen by the KGB in East Germany.

episodes.name: Brain Wash
episodes.overview: While Callahan is having her hair shampooed, Jaime overhears her revealing top-secret information which endangers Oscar's life.

episodes.name: Escape to Love
episodes.overview: The son of an Iron Curtain scientist threatens to foul-up his own rescue when he falls in love with Jaime.

episodes.name: Max
episodes.overview: Max, the bionic dog, is kidnapped by foreign agents, while Jaime lies helpless in a hospital bed undergoing a bionic check-up.

episodes.name: Over the Hill Spy
episodes.overview: An elderly Soviet spy, long believed dead, threatens  U.S. security, so Oscar must convince a retired OSI agent to work  with Jaime and identify his Russian counterpart.

episodes.name: All For One
episodes.overview: Jaime enrolls in college to stop a young computer whiz who has been stealing thousands of dollars from the OSI.

episodes.name: The Pyramid
episodes.overview: Jaime and Chris get trapped in an underground pyramid with an  alien sentinel who warns them that Earth faces imminent destruction.

episodes.name: The Antidote
episodes.overview: A deadly poison will kill Jaime unless she reveals the location  of a secret conference in exchange for the antidote.

episodes.name: The Martians Are Coming, the Martians Are Coming
episodes.overview: While working on a project to track  U.F.O.s, Dr. Rudy Wells and Ray Fisk are abducted by a flying saucer.

episodes.name: Sanctuary Earth
episodes.overview: A satellite returns unexpectedly to Earth, and Jaime discovers that a 14-year-old girl from another planet is on board.

episodes.name: Deadly Music
episodes.overview: An enemy scientist invents a device that attracts sharks underwater, and Jaime becomes the intended victim.

episodes.name: Which One Is Jaime?
episodes.overview: Oscar Goldman's secretary, Peggy Callahan, is abducted by a  band of dangerous kidnappers when she is mistaken for Jaime.

episodes.name: Out of Body
episodes.overview: When a young American Indian is framed and injured in the theft of a deadly new weapon, his spirit leaves his body and aids Jaime in the search for the real criminals.

episodes.name: Long Live the King
episodes.overview: Jaime poses as a Middle Eastern king's social secretary in order to prevent his assassination during his visit to New York City.

episodes.name: Rancho Outcast
episodes.overview: Jaime is paired with a double-crossing convict who claims he can identify the criminal that the OSI is seeking.

episodes.name: On the Run
episodes.overview: To search for a life of her own, Jaime resigns from the OSI and then flees for her life when the government tries to confine her to a compound for retired agents.
